chargeHist.descr: Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary T. Dorr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with anyone under 18 except as allowed by PO.
No contact with victim or her family.

Defendant must be in full compliance w/ Sex Offender registration laws.
Any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.
DNA sample w/ surcharges.

Full amt of bill paid by the County and assessment added to case.  Credit for deposit given.  Party(ies) copied.
Sentencing held on 3/1/16 before Judge Greg Grau

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 9:08am
State appears by DDA T.Wetzsteon; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Attorney Richard Lawson.

COURT notes receipt of documents in support of defendant.
COURT questions parties re: PSI corrections -- Atty Lawson makes statements on corrections.

State makes argument on sentencing
Argument on sentencing by Attorney Lawson
Defendant makes statement

COURT  makes findings.
COURT ORDERS>>
Ct. 1>> 11 Years TOTAL: 5 years incarceration and 6 years ES
CONDITIONS OF ES: No contact with victim or her family; Defendant must be in full compliance with WI Sex offender registration laws; No contact w/anyone under 18 except as allowed by PO; Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; CC; DNA sample and surcharge; Financial obligations - anything not paid by prison wages are ordered as condition of ES
>>Defendant is NOT eligible for SAP or CIP
>>Credit for 294 days of time served.

COURT advises counsel re: PSI being kept confidential.
COURT remands defendant to be transported to WI State Prison System.

Adj: 10:13am
to Judge Grau from Atty. Lawson re: psych exam - stj
to Judge Grau from Atty. Lawson
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 8:48 am 
State appears by DDA Theresa Wetzsteon; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Richard Lawson.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 2 (Child Entincement-Sexual Contact)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 3 (Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties (including WI Sex Offender registration) & ques def to understanding. 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: PSI to be completed including incorporating an evaluation pursuant to 972.15(1) into the PSI. 
State notes parties have agreed to the release of previous psycho-sexual evaluation to the DOC and notes it will provide a copy to the DOC. 
Sentencing set for March 1, 2016 at 9:00 am in Br. 4. 
Bond Continues.

COURT addresses Motion to Modify Bond>>
Arguments by both State and Attorney Lawson.
